place.name: CERRIGCEINWEN
place.gazetteerText: CERRIG-CEINWEN, a parish in the district and county of Anglesey; 3 miles N of Bodorgan r. station, and 5½ NE of Aberffraw. Post Town, Llangefni, under Bangor. Acres, 1,582. Real property, £1,621. Pop., 465. Houses, 108. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage, annexed to the rectory of Llangristiolus, in the diocese of Bangor. The church was built in 1861; is in the early English style; and consists of nave and chancel, with bell-turret and vestry. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
